trans-unit.source: Step 6: Configure an XML One-Way Bridge
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Configure an XML One-Way Bridge

trans-unit.source: This topic provides instructions on how to configure an <token>one-way</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides instructions on how to configure an <token>one-way</token>.

trans-unit.source: As part of the <token>one-way</token> configuration, we’ll do the following:
trans-unit.target: As part of the <token>one-way</token> configuration, we’ll do the following:

trans-unit.source: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to process the flat-file message of the type we created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to process the flat-file message of the type we created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Through promoted properties, extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> record (before message transformation) and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> (after message transformation).
trans-unit.target: Through promoted properties, extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> record (before message transformation) and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> (after message transformation).

trans-unit.source: We’ll track the values for these two as the message gets processed by the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: We’ll track the values for these two as the message gets processed by the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to use the <embeddedLabel>Map.trfm</embeddedLabel> <token>transform</token> we created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to use the <embeddedLabel>Map.trfm</embeddedLabel> <token>transform</token> we created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to track the messages it processes.
trans-unit.target: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to track the messages it processes.

trans-unit.source: To configure an <token>one-way</token>
trans-unit.target: To configure an <token>one-way</token>

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop an <token>one-way</token> from toolbox to the <token>msgflow</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop an <token>one-way</token> from toolbox to the <token>msgflow</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: For the Entity Name and Relative Address properties of the bridge, enter <userInput>ProcessOrders</userInput> for the value.
trans-unit.target: For the Entity Name and Relative Address properties of the bridge, enter <userInput>ProcessOrders</userInput> for the value.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>one-way</token> on the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>one-way</token> on the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: On the <token>one-way</token> design area, within the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: On the <token>one-way</token> design area, within the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box, from the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the <embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel> message type, select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to associate the request schema with the <token>one-way</token>, and then click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box, from the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the <embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel> message type, select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to associate the request schema with the <token>one-way</token>, and then click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The schema that you selected should now be listed under the <embeddedLabel>Request Message Type</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: The schema that you selected should now be listed under the <embeddedLabel>Request Message Type</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: Configure the pre-transform <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema.
trans-unit.target: Configure the pre-transform <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema.

trans-unit.source: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Source (Read From)
trans-unit.target: Source (Read From)

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Xpath</embeddedLabel> from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Xpath</embeddedLabel> from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Identifier
trans-unit.target: Identifier

trans-unit.source: Specify the Xpath query to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> from the request schema.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Xpath query to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> from the request schema.

trans-unit.source: You can get the Xpath query from the schema editor.
trans-unit.target: You can get the Xpath query from the schema editor.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> element in the schema editor, and in the Properties window look for the value of the <embeddedLabel>Instance Xpath</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> element in the schema editor, and in the Properties window look for the value of the <embeddedLabel>Instance Xpath</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: That should be the Xpath query for the node.
trans-unit.target: That should be the Xpath query for the node.

trans-unit.source: Message Type
trans-unit.target: Message Type

trans-unit.source: Select the schema pertaining to <embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select the schema pertaining to <embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Property (Write To)
trans-unit.target: Property (Write To)

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the property that you are defining.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the property that you are defining.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify <userInput>OrderId</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify <userInput>OrderId</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Data Type
trans-unit.target: Data Type

trans-unit.source: Specifies the data type for the property.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the data type for the property.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify <userInput>string</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify <userInput>string</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to use the <token>transform</token> created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to use the <token>transform</token> created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Within the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Map Selection</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Within the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Map Selection</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: From the list of <token>transform</token>s displayed in the dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Map.trfm</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the list of <token>transform</token>s displayed in the dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Map.trfm</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You created this <token>transform</token> in the previous steps.
trans-unit.target: You created this <token>transform</token> in the previous steps.

trans-unit.source: Configure the post-transform <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema.
trans-unit.target: Configure the post-transform <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema.

trans-unit.source: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Source (Read From)
trans-unit.target: Source (Read From)

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Xpath</embeddedLabel> from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Xpath</embeddedLabel> from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Identifier
trans-unit.target: Identifier

trans-unit.source: Specify the Xpath query to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> from the request schema.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Xpath query to extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> from the request schema.

trans-unit.source: Message Type
trans-unit.target: Message Type

trans-unit.source: Select the schema pertaining to <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select the schema pertaining to <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Property (Write To)
trans-unit.target: Property (Write To)

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the property that you are defining.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the property that you are defining.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify <userInput>TotalAmount</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify <userInput>TotalAmount</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Data Type
trans-unit.target: Data Type

trans-unit.source: Specifies the data type for the property.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the data type for the property.

trans-unit.source: Specify <userInput>long</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Specify <userInput>long</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the project.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the project.

trans-unit.source: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to track message properties and other data, for the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> properties you just promoted.
trans-unit.target: Configure the <token>bridge</token> to track message properties and other data, for the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> properties you just promoted.

trans-unit.source: Go back to the MessageFlowItinerary.bcs file, select the <token>one-way</token>, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis (…)
trans-unit.target: Go back to the MessageFlowItinerary.bcs file, select the <token>one-way</token>, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis (…)

trans-unit.source: against <embeddedLabel>Track Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: against <embeddedLabel>Track Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Track message processing events</embeddedLabel> check box to track detailed information such as when a stage starts, completes, or faults; when an activity within a stage starts, completes, or faults; whether an artifact gets retrieved, etc.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Track message processing events</embeddedLabel> check box to track detailed information such as when a stage starts, completes, or faults; when an activity within a stage starts, completes, or faults; whether an artifact gets retrieved, etc.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Track all message properties</embeddedLabel> check box, and then select the properties you want to track.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Track all message properties</embeddedLabel> check box, and then select the properties you want to track.

trans-unit.source: Note that the dialog box lists the properties that you promoted within any of the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stages in a bridge.
trans-unit.target: Note that the dialog box lists the properties that you promoted within any of the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stages in a bridge.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration and go back to the <token>msgflow</token> designer area.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration and go back to the <token>msgflow</token> designer area.

trans-unit.source: Connect the FTP source component to the <token>one-way</token> and the <token>bridge</token> to the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.
trans-unit.target: Connect the FTP source component to the <token>one-way</token> and the <token>bridge</token> to the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.

trans-unit.source: Set the filter condition on the connector between the <token>bridge</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.
trans-unit.target: Set the filter condition on the connector between the <token>bridge</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.

trans-unit.source: Select the connector between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.
trans-unit.target: Select the connector between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Filter Configuration</embeddedLabel> dialog box, set the filter condition to <embeddedLabel>Match All</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Filter Configuration</embeddedLabel> dialog box, set the filter condition to <embeddedLabel>Match All</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the Route action so that the outgoing message to the LOB application has a SOAP action header.
trans-unit.target: Set the Route action so that the outgoing message to the LOB application has a SOAP action header.

trans-unit.source: Open <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel> and navigate to the <token>ssNoVersion</token> <token>lobrelay</token> we created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Open <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel> and navigate to the <token>ssNoVersion</token> <token>lobrelay</token> we created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Right click the relay, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and for the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> property, copy the value of the first operation.
trans-unit.target: Right click the relay, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and for the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> property, copy the value of the first operation.

trans-unit.source: On the <token>msgflow</token> design area, click the connector between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.
trans-unit.target: On the <token>msgflow</token> design area, click the connector between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Property (Read From)</embeddedLabel> section, select <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel>, and then paste the value that you copied.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Property (Read From)</embeddedLabel> section, select <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel>, and then paste the value that you copied.

trans-unit.source: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.
trans-unit.target: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Destination (Write To)</embeddedLabel> section, set the Type to <embeddedLabel>SOAP</embeddedLabel> and the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Destination (Write To)</embeddedLabel> section, set the Type to <embeddedLabel>SOAP</embeddedLabel> and the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.
trans-unit.target: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box to add the route action.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box to add the route action.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save changes to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save changes to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
